page.title: 16CRIME IN SOUTHSEA
page.content: Most crimes committed in Southsea are related to alcohol or unemploy- ment.The most common are burglary, vandalism and auto-theft.According to local police, about 80% of these crimes are committed by unemployed people. A lot of crimes have something to do with drugs, such as heroin,LSD,cannabis,cocaine and solvent abuse. If the users are unemployed they obtain money by theft. The main area where drugs are, is around Nightingale Road."Stranger danger" is another problem, though offenders are usually local people known to the police. There are seventy police for the area, though with office work few patrol the beat. Other problems stem from the ports in summer e.g.traffic problems and shoplifting especially by young foreign tourists.
